revised_title: Analysis of Carinthian Molybdate of Lead and Experiments on Molybdic Acid
tldr: The author analyzes the Carinthian Molybdate of Lead and conducts experiments on Molybdic Acid. The ore is found to be composed of lead and molybdic acid, making it a unique mineral. The molybdenum compound can be found in crystalline, white powder, or citron-colored oxide forms, each with different solubility properties.
